_inspectorSnowReport.Report: The storm clouds are back! A new storm has arrived, dropping off 2 inches of new snow last night and promising another 2 to 4 inches inches today. The main event begins tonight, with 8 to 22 inches expected overnight and continued snowfall on Monday. A DJ will be spinning outside Moonbeam Lodge today to welcome the storm. Powderhorn is open for the season! We now have six lifts spinning and 38 trails open. Early season conditions exist over much of the mountain, especially on ungroomed runs. Expert skills are required on Eagle, Powderhorn, and Sunrise terrain. Beginners should stick to Link and Moonbeam Express. Conditions were firm on the lower mountain yesterday and will likely be the same today until the incoming snow softens the surface. Please check your speed and be aware of other skiers and riders. Enjoy a snowy Sunday on the hill!

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: Know The Code, limit your speed, and stay in control while skiing and riding.
